metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7141 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
curl and libcurl before 7.50.2, when built with NSS and the libnsspem.so library is available at runtime, allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of a TLS connection by leveraging reuse of a previously loaded client certificate from file for a connection for which no certificate has been set, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-5420.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.10
libcurl3 - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.10
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.10
libcurl3-nss - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.10
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> only affects libcurl3-nss which is not widely used libcurl3 (OpenSSL based)

criterions.comment: curl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.35.0-1ubuntu2.10').
